meta.description: Massu AI social funnel engagement tracker. Single source of truth for all social engagement activity.

scans.notes: Cooling period. All targets either already engaged or no fresh governance angles. One marginal opportunity (Gergely AI-content fatigue) skipped.
Refresh scan ~23:00 UTC. No new posts from any target. Gergely AI-content thread growing (64K views, 153 replies). Cooling period continues.

Response check on all 6 posted replies. 0 responses from targets or others. 3 replies visible in Relevant sort (Gergely, Simon, McKay). 1 reply buried (Karpathy, 944 replies). 1 thread URL broken (Boris Security). 1 URL was placeholder, now fixed (Boris Worktrees).

Post-cooling scan. 2 opportunities from Simon Willison: Agentic Engineering Patterns guide (23.8K views, 30 replies) and Red/green TDD follow-up (4.5K views, 5 replies). Both highly aligned. All other targets: no governance-aligned posts. Boris in celebration mode, Karpathy silent, McKay silent 5 days, Gergely in hot-take mode (Anthropic distillation, Google bans).

reply.content: Very cool. The scanning side is a huge step. Curious whether the longer-term vision includes enforcement at generation time too, not just detection after the fact?

replies.notes: First reply ever posted. Short, question-based. Thread URL returns 'page doesn't exist' as of 2026-02-23 check. Tweet may have been deleted or URL was approximate.

thread.topic: Git worktrees for parallel Claude Code sessions

replies.notes: Reply about context isolation in parallel sessions. Exact text not captured. Thread at 1.2M views, 429 replies as of 2026-02-23. Reply not visible in Relevant sort (buried in 429 replies).

thread.topic: AI coding bot takes down Amazon service - verification/monitoring gap

reply.content: This is the right framing. The AI didn't cause the outage. The missing verification layer did. I run automated checks on every file write my AI agents make. Build gates, pattern scanning, blast radius analysis before any value change touches production. The number of subtle...

replies.notes: Reply about governance gap. Visible in Relevant sort as of 2026-02-23. 144 views, 0 engagement. Content truncated in snapshot, full text not captured.

thread.topic: Sus'd to run 400K lines of vibe coded OpenClaw

replies.notes: Reply about trust/verification for vibe coded systems. Thread at 2.5M views, 944 replies as of 2026-02-23. Reply not visible in Relevant sort (buried).

thread.topic: Claw as term of art for OpenClaw-like agent systems

reply.content: The interesting question for this whole category is: what does the trust model look like? Running someone else's 400K lines of vibe coded agents with access to your keys is a governance problem, not just a security one. Especially when these agents are acting autonomously. The...

replies.notes: Reply about trust model for autonomous agent systems. Visible in Relevant sort as of 2026-02-23. 142 views, 0 engagement.

reply.content: Clear rules that are consistently enforced is exactly the right ask. Same principle applies to the code itself. When your AI agents can't tell what's allowed vs. not allowed, you get the same confusion downstream. Explicit rules, automated enforcement, zero ambiguity. Works for...

replies.notes: Reply about clear rules and consistent enforcement. Visible in Relevant sort as of 2026-02-23. Only 3 views, lowest of all replies.

thread.topic: Red/green TDD for coding agents - test-first development patterns

reply.content: This matches my experience exactly. The test-first loop gives you a verification layer the agent can't skip past. I've extended this by having the agent also write regression tests for every bug it introduces, so one failure creates multiple independent checks going forward.

replies.notes: First reply after 3-day cooling period. Second reply to Simon (different topic from reply-005). Thread had only 5 replies at time of posting, high visibility expected. Part of Simon's Agentic Engineering Patterns guide series.

weekly_metrics.notes: Launch day. 6 replies across 5 target accounts. Phase 1 engagement. Response check on Feb 23: 0 responses, 3/6 replies visible in Relevant sort.
Post-cooling period resume. 1 reply to Simon Willison's Agentic Engineering Patterns TDD post. Used 5_layer_defense angle (new angle, diversifying from governance_gap).
